kesako.common

Class Search

  • java.lang.Object
    • kesako.common.Search

  • public class Search
extends java.lang.Object
    Implement the search mechanism.
    To make a search, use the method doSearch. This method return the status of the search (RESULTS, NO_RESULTS, RESULT_ERROR)
    To access the results of the search use the method getDocs
    The class implements the Log4J logging system.
    Author:
    Frederic SACHOT

    • Method Detail

      • doSearch

        public int doSearch(java.lang.String query,
           java.lang.String sortingString,
           java.lang.String filter,
           int start,
           boolean initSorting)
        Make a research. Return the status of the search and store the results in vDoc.
        The syntax of the different parameters is the SOLR syntax.
        Parameters:
        query - query-string of the research
        sortingString - string to sort results
        filter - implementation of the facet mechanism
        start - The method doSearch return 20 results beginning from start to start+20 or nbFound if nbFound < start+20
        initSorting - if initSorting=TRUE, results are sorted by date
        Returns:
        RESULTS if there is results, NO_RESULT if there is no result, RESULT_ERROR if an error occurs during the search

      • getDocs

        public java.util.Vector<ResultDoc> getDocs()
        Return the list of results

      • getNbFound

        public long getNbFound()
        Return the number of results
